> The `data` of `paint` event is empty when loading simple local pages.

What kind of page did you check? I couldn't reproduce it and also in the tests there is a local page that is being loaded.

> The size of `data` is wrong, current implement uses the size of pointer (`sizeof(bitmap_pixels)`).

Fixed in #6713 

> Crashes when opening devtools for offscreen window.

This is because devtools by default appears as a guest content in the browser window's webcontents and we haven't implemented guest contents yet. That's why the `<webview>` tag isn't working either yet. However the devtools works properly in detached state.

> We should probably show a dummy view indicating it is offscreen instead of provide NULL.

What exactly do you mean by that? The browser window's `NativeWindow` appears as a blank view now, it could be considered as a dummy view.

> The offscreen window is affecting the rendering of other windows. Try running `./script/test.py -g offscreen` and then refreshing the window.

Yeah, I'm still investigating this issue, but it seems the problem is somehow, that we create the browser windows from the renderer process with `remote.require('electron').BrowserWindow` and this way it tries to create the webContents in GPU enabled mode though it is disabled.
All of the problems solved. âœ¨
